Overview: Bennett Aerospace, Inc. is a Federal Contracting company and in accordance with Executive Order 14042, all employees of Bennett Aerospace, Inc. will adhere to all vaccination requirements put forth in the signed Executive Order 14042.  Path Out of the Pandemic: COVID-19 Action Plan  and signed Executive Order 14042,  Ensuring Adequate COVID   Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors , which  details federal contractor vaccination requirements and compliance with CDC guidelines. About Us: Bennett Aerospace, Inc .  is headquartered in the Research Triangle Park area of North Carolina. Established in 2008, we are a woman owned, veteran owned, certified 8(a) small business that provides scientific, engineering, and technical advisory services to our customers. Primarily focused on Federal Government clients in general, and the Department of Defense in particular, Bennett Aerospace provides expert guidance and advice on the full spectrum of R&D and its applications in engineering, science, medicine, and IT, as well as providing strategic programmatic support in order to meet customer goals and objectives. Bennett Aerospace is a rapidly growing business focused on hiring and retaining the best people. Job Description: Bennett Aerospace, Inc.  is seeking a highly motivated  Statistician  located in Arlington, VA. The Statistician will provide services supporting data analytics in the BIC and will require qualifications, capabilities and skills related to statistical analysis, modeling, trend analysis, forecasting, mathematical formulations, performance measurement, and data presentation. The statistician is a subject matter expert in statistical theory, techniques and methodology and is responsible for developing and conducting research, compiling internal statistical data, analyzing data and preparing reports and briefings. The statistician performs data management by collecting, analyzing, interpreting and presenting quantitative information (data elements) in order to advise on statistical trending, forecast improvement opportunities, develop performance measures, and recommend strategy. The statistician supports the development and revision of statistical methodologies needed to meet strategic objectives and analyzes data to evaluate and determine future behaviors to improve performance. The statistician focuses on collecting and providing data analytics that are descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive to leadership, program offices, and other functional areas. Responsibilities: Key Responsibilities and Duties: Duties include but are not limited to the following: Utilize the systems available to obtain data for research studies and reports. Determine appropriate statistical procedures for analysis of data and accomplishes its implementation. Solves statistical and data table relationship problems encountered in research and data management situations. Create multiple programs and/or scripts to achieve queries and comprehensive statistical analyses for given data set in multiple combinations of variables and time-sequences. Consolidate data from different databases and prepares an integrated analysis. Interpret the statistical significance of project findings. Multiple projects are coordinated and kept in progress simultaneously. Plan and conduct special studies/projects as assigned. Plan and conduct statistical research projects to evaluate, design and tabulate results in the general area of statistics and experimental design. Study subordinate or peer technical reviews of professional studies, research and analysis and challenges or validates the findings by considering the impact on national missions, programs, and/or directives. Serves as a recognized authority, expert, and leader in a statistics or related regulatory field of specification. Develops broad, complex programs of scientific conclusions, opinions, and recommendations that are critical to the mission. Serves as a technical authority, leader, and expert in the development and interpretation of organization guidelines. Reviews organizational statistical measurements, reports, and documents for policy implications, and impacts on organization-wide, district, and industry activities. Report and/or publish, when appropriate, the experimental design and statistical aspects of statistical methodology and research findings. Give briefings and presentations on the effort. Issue reports, whether for publication or for internal use only, as sole author in collaboration with colleagues. Provide expert analysis and advice on Division/District/agency-wide programs or issues of national impact, to include: Applying advanced techniques to interpret and evaluate findings resulting from analysis. Reconciling conflicts between basic policies and program goals. Providing expert advice and recommendations to top management officials. Identifying reasons for the nature and/or extent of program-related problems that arise and investigates areas in need of improvements. Recommending options that remedy problematic situations. Writing comprehensive resolution recommendations. Formally presenting findings before large and diverse audiences, such as Federal, state and local government representatives, special interest groups, the community, the media, etc. When existing techniques are not applicable, develops new statistical methods using expert knowledge of mathematical and applied statistics. Develops survey methodology and analyzes data using parametric and nonparametric methods, mixed model analysis, multivariate analysis, profit analysis, survival analysis, logistic regression, linear regression, ordinal regression, multivariate regression, principal components analysis and discriminate analysis. Qualifications: Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in statistics or comparable field of study is required Five years of specialized experience related to the required duties Skills and Abilities: Time management, organization and prioritization skills Ability to build and maintain relationships with internal employees as well as outside sources Communication skills Exhibit a high level of confidentiality Ability to adapt quickly and effectively to change Knowledge of Microsoft Office software products Security Requirements: Clearance Level Required: Not Listed Applicants selected will be subject to a Government background investigation and must meet eligibility and suitability requirements. Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain a US Government security clearance. Successful Pass of Bennett Aerospace Background Investigation, Drug Screening and Credit Check. Compensation: Competitive market-based salary, commensurate with experience and education. Comprehensive benefits package available. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veteran/Disabled

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us. Use Artificial Intelligence to solve problems for a safer world! At MITRE we work across the whole of government to identify opportunities that shape our nation’s future. We use our strengths to build coalitions of collaboration that strengthen government and create positive change for citizens. You can be a part of this! MITRE’s AI-enhanced Discovery and Decisions department has a need for a Lead Artificial Intelligence Engineer. Our work programs need top individuals with a passion for artificial intelligence, experience and proficiency with algorithmic design and development; specifically, in machine learning (including deep learning), and one or more of the following technical areas: decision science, human machine teaming, cognitive science, multi-agent systems, knowledge-based reasoning, automated planning, semantics, and ontologies. You will have opportunities to work on a wide range of problems, leading and working with teams possessing a broad range of skills. Your experience will allow you to influence research directions; evaluate the challenges and potential solutions for designing, developing, and fielding artificial intelligence solutions that inform mission-critical decisions; assess the adequacy and maturation of existing research programs and shape their technical and programmatic direction; and identify new areas where research and development are needed to strengthen the nation’s growing artificial intelligence capabilities. Job Responsibilities: Work on, or lead, a cross-functional team to develop and implement Al algorithms that can help solve wicked problems Apply modern engineering techniques to develop decision support software prototypes Propose and execute novel, cutting-edge research in Al-enhanced decision systems Evaluate Al solutions in the context of sponsor requirements and produce actionable recommendations Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering discipline related to artificial intelligence 5+ years impactful experience in Al-relevant fields, such as machine learning, deep learning, multi-agent systems, planning, and data science. Demonstrated ability to articulate Al-specific challenges and identify gaps. A keen interesting in learning about and rapidly responding to new problems across a variety of domains. Excellent communication written and verbal skills to articulate challenging technical concepts to both lay and expert audiences. Ability to work independently to learn new technologies, techniques, processes, languages, platforms, and systems. Ability to work independently and as a member of cross-functional teams. Experience with programming languages such as C++ and Python. Must be a US citizen able to obtain and maintain a US government clearance (e.g., DoD Secret) Preferred Qualifications : Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering discipline related to artificial intelligence. Track record of successful deployment of AI-enhanced decision systems that have been used by key decision makers. Active DoD Secret clearance. The NPDB (a program within HHS and HRSA) is chartered to improve the quality of health care in the U.S. by requiring state licensing boards, hospitals and other health care entities, and professional societies to identify healthcare practitioners who engage in adverse or unprofessional behavior; and to restrict the ability of physicians, dentists, and other health care practitioners to move from state to state without disclosure or discovery of their previous medical malpractice payment and adverse action history. Must write succinctly and clearly and explain complex situations in plain English to technical and non-technical audiences. Work experience in Conversational AI, Machine Learning NLP, Dialog Management, including new and emerging technologies in Machine Learning/Deep Learning, AI, and big data Proven knowledge of Voicebots, ChatBot and experience utilizing frameworks like RASA, AWS Lex, Cortana, API.ai, wit.ai, or equivalents Extensive hands-on experience (3+ years) in building software and AI platform/solutions, able to translate business requirements into clean/logical design, strong skills in coding, design and code review, sprint management, DevOps; able to deliver under pressure. job_Description: Overview: PURPOSE : Candidate supports the Nuclear Threat Detection Network team and development of ISR (intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance) related capabilities. job_title: Staff Data Scientist, VMware Cloud on AWS - Opportunity for Working Remotely Reston, VA
job_Description: Are you passionate about solving complex optimization problems in a data-driven manner, supporting business decisions worth hundreds of millions of dollars? If you have solid expertise in Data Science, and have work closely with data analytics and software development teams, you are invited to apply. We build the Capacity Platform for VMware Cloud on AWS – the new Software Defined Data Center as a Service offering of VMware. We provide foundations for the "Cloud" aspect of our partnership with AWS by managing our customers' capacity demands through automation, while optimizing our cost. It is a dynamic area, in which our team has direct VMware revenue impact, drives customer-facing features, works on variety of AWS integrations, develops Data Science driven solutions and has E2E ownership of our services lifecycle. In the Staff Data Science position, you will: Lead team of Data Analytics and Data Scientists, providing expertise in solving non-trivial optimization problems in a complex business domain, in a data-driven manner. Drive new products evolution with analysis of risk, usage patterns, market demand, customer segmentation etc. Envision development platform evolution: streamlining the generation of Data Science intelligence, its integration in automated operations systems and the corresponding Analytics Tools supporting the final business decision making. Our team has delivery-oriented and humancentric values, so we are looking for Smart and Driven people, who like to work in challenging problem area and produce solid solutions based on team collaboration. Responsibilities: You own requirements gathering and ideation in a challenging problem area. You provide expertise and leadership in solving non-trivial optimization problems in complex domain area. You are responsible for driving end-to-end architecture, design and implementation for the analytics and data science solutions, developed by the team. You provide leadership in software development methodologies and hands on with POC development, architect and design solutions. Responsible for the entire analytics and data science solutions life cycle including research, design, application and deployment architecture, development, testing, continuous deployment and continuous delivery to production. Minimum Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in the analytics and data science area. BS or MS degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science. Strong knowledge in linear algebra, calculus and numerical analysis. Proven background in fundamentals of computer science and development process. Proficiency with SQL. General Programming knowledge – data structures, algorithms, memory management etc. Excellent communication skills and fluent English (speaking/reading/writing). Strong problem-solving skills Passion to innovate, learn and share knowledge, invent and patent new algorithms and technologies. Preferred qualifications: Experience with AWS public cloud offerings Experience with Mode Analytics, Tableau or other reporting tools Experience in SaaS oriented architecture and integrations. Experience in crafting software with continuous integration and delivery. Experience in working with multiple company stakeholders, including PM, R&D, Management, Marketing, Sales, Execs etc. Benefits and perks of working at VMware: You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com. Employee Stock Purchase Plan Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types Generous Time Off Programs 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.) Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status Due to the Biden Administration issuing an Executive Order (EO) that effectively mandates COVID-19 vaccination for all U.S. based employees of federal contractors and subcontractors, all U.S. based VMware employees will be required to have their final vaccination dose (e.g., second dose of Pfizer or Moderna, or single dose of J&J) by January 4, 2022. Specifically, this means that all U.S. based VMware employees will need to be fully vaccinated by January 18th, 2022, or by their first date of employment if after that date, subject to legally required accommodations. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design  Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development  A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience.  3+ years of software development experience, with background in design patterns, data structures, and test-driven development.  Experience building and owning large scale production software engineering (e.g. service oriented architecture across many teams, continuous deployment, monitoring and alarming)  Job summary Are you excited about building high-performance robotic systems that can perceive, learn, and act intelligently? The Robotics AI team is creating first of a kind robotic workcells. We are seeking software engineers to help with our initial robotic deployments. This includes building computer vision systems, ML and AI models, robotic control and motion planning, and process management. It also includes end-to-end ownership of decision explanation, fault detection, monitoring, A/B testing, large scale model training, simulation, hardware integration, and more. This work spans prototypes in the lab as well as wide-deployment systems. As a software engineer, you will help plan the roadmap, design ML systems, implement, test, and monitor services in our robotic fleet.   Robotics experience  Experience with one of the following:  Production-level machine learning  Computer vision (e.g. a variety of neural network architectures using TensorFlow or MxNet, fusion with other sensors)  Hardware integration (e.g. hardware release cycles, heterogeneous hardware fleets)  Building and testing real-time or safety-critical systems  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. AI Financial Forecast Analyst Location/Site North and South American Sites Job Purpose/Overview Mars has defined a bold initiative to create the “Finance of Tomorrow”, taking this opportunity to be architects of value creation enabled by agile, digital-centric Finance associates. Today, our forecasting processes and systems are highly manual, Excel based and very iterative. For this reason, a critical initiative that will enable “Finance of Tomorrow” will be predictive financial solutions, bringing higher degrees of accuracy and greater efficiency by moving to data driven, systems-integrated and automated AI Financial Forecasting. An AI Financial Forecasting Solution has been designed and developed. It has been deployed to 10 business units already and we are scaling the solution globally. We are seeking someone who is digital savvy with sound financial forecasting experience to join the central team as an analyst/subject matter expert and liaison between the business and the central technical team to drive continuous improvement and the rapid global deployment of the AI Forecasting Solution. Key Responsibilities Forecasting Process Ownership for a group of approximately 6 – 8 business units. Monitor the plausibility of the AI Driver Based Machine Forecast providing input for improvement initiatives Work with the Data Science team to drive the continuous improvement in forecast accuracy Serves as a liaison between the business units, the Mars digital technology and third-party technical team to translate business needs into new feature / enhancement concept designs and provide feedback and guidance through development. Testing / quality control in Production Runs, Enhancement Developments and Deployment Waves AI Financial Forecasting Subject Matter Expert responsible for end user training and capability building Context and Scope Initiates and manages the forecast Production Run Process and validates the machine’s forecast for plausibility before releasing it to the business. Loads the forecast into the Data Lake for subsequent reporting via the Power BI Forecast Reporting App. Works closely with the business and technical team to identify and resolve problems Strong collaboration with the business units’ forecast owners and the technical team to identify and drive continuous improvements based on business feedback and needs Provides user training for new forecast owners and organizes expert led education sessions to build knowledge about data science and AI forecasting within the business Job Specifications/Qualifications 1. Education & Professional Qualification University degree in Finance, Accounting or related experience 2. Knowledge/Experience 3+ years related experience Strong understanding of Financial Forecasting Business Partnering Collaboration and Influence in a Matrix organization

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer. Location : USA - Remote We are seeking a Sr. Data Science Product Manager to join the Life Science Solutions Group (LSG) Data Science team. As our team grows, we are seeking individuals who want to join the fast growing data science field. The Sr. Data Science Product Managers on the team are trusted data science leaders that help our division business partners achieve their strategy by using our data science capabilities with the ultimate goal of being leaders in digital science. The Sr. Data Science Product Manager works collaboratively with data scientists to build and deploy solutions that support our divisional partner goals. Discover Impactful Work: The Sr. Data Science Product Manager practices strategic analysis to understand the business challenges and translates those into solutions for our customers. They work as a data science consultant, developing solutions that address business challenges and opportunities across the Life Sciences Group. They develop data science capabilities that scale across teams, regions, and functions. The Sr. Data Science Product Manager partners with sales and marketing leadership to align, develop and deliver complex data science solutions in an agile development environment. They operate in a matrix organization, often without authority, to both establish data science strategic direction for the division and implement projects that achieve the data science goals. The Sr. Data Science Product Manager works in an inclusive environment where continual improvement and learning are part of the process. They are proficient as a product owner and passionate about increasing business value and product backlog optimization. You recommend and apply best-practices leveraging insights from other data science initiatives across Thermo Fisher Scientific. Responsibilities Manages cross-divisional strategic initiatives with significant impact across functions or divisions Collaborates with the business to understand business problems and strategic direction Influences and leads across organizational boundaries to deliver cross-functional, complex initiatives Defines a vision and translates requirements into capabilities that partners want and will use Designs and delivers data science solutions that can scale across teams and functions Expands scope of impact by leveraging the capabilities of others Keys to Success: Education Bachelor's degree required Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Analytics/Data Science preferred Experience 8+ years experience in data product management, program management, analytics or consulting required Life Sciences experience required Certified Scrum Product Ownership (CSPO) certification preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Proven ability to develop, align and deliver data science solutions in the face of uncertainty Effective at setting a strategic vision and works with leadership to align on direction Intellectually curious; Asks the right questions for a deeper understanding Effective data science product leader with experience increasing business value Influences across organizational boundaries to deliver cross-functional, complex initiatives Builds constructive and effective relationships with relevant partners Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000 colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued. Overview: BigBear.ai  is seeking a  Data Manager  to support to the Air Operations Center Weapon System (AOC WS) program, which is within the Digital Directorate and located at Langley AFB, VA. What you will do: Analyzes current work procedures and implements adjustments for maximum efficiency. Lead the effort to research, and identify how Agile/Scrum principles integrate into the ongoing work efforts—designed framework for local leadership. Authors and manages currency of Configuration Management Plans (CMP) for Sustainment and EMD programs; researched and revamped documents to include data engineering, data integration, data quality, and security. Applies knowledge of concepts of evolutionary acquisition, spiral development/delivery, and incremental development to new processes under development for acquiring new AOC weapon system capabilities. Continuous interface with Northrop Grumman (NG) MA to improve the Quality, CM, and DM programs to allow better synergy, harmony and situational awareness of related tasks. Provides strategic guidance based on Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats analysis to ensure transformational changes for cross-functional teams— a new standard set for the delivery of products and services across the entire enterprise. Coordinates, reviews, and assess Basis of Estimate for man-hour proposals for mission assurance, configuration/data management, and quality assurance relationship builder. Institutes and maintains a database to track Class I/II Enterprise Change Proposals Provides detailed EMD CM requirements and associated Technical Specification Guide for the inclusion of the status accounting tool Change Management Interim Tool (CMIT) What you need to have: Clearance: must possess and maintain a Secret Clearance Bachelors degree Experience with JIRA and Confluence systems. Progressive experience in managing configuration of software, engineering documents, design drawings, engineering changes and notices, and planning/conducting design audits. In-depth understanding of the configuration change control process, role of the Change Control Board (CCB), and change control documentation. Demonstrated characteristics of a self-starter who is able to work independently and effectively interact with program team members and senior leadership. Exhibit excellent interpersonal relationships and the ability to work as part of a multi-disciplined team. Possess excellent writing and presentation skills. Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and SharePoint What we'd like you to have: Advanced Degree Previous Data Management experience on a DoD contract About BigBear.ai: A leader in decision dominance for more than 20 years, BigBear.ai operationalizes artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale through its end-to-end data analytics platform. The Company uses its proprietary AI/ML technology to support its customers’ decision-making processes and deliver practical solutions that work in complex, realistic and imperfect data environments. BigBear.ai’s composable AI-powered platform solutions work together as often as they stand alone: Observe (data ingestion and conflation), Orient (composable machine learning at scale), and Dominate (visual anticipatory intelligence and optimization). BigBear.ai’s customers, which include the U.S. Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, the U.S. Federal Government, as well as customers in the commercial sector, rely on BigBear.ai’s high value software products and technology to analyze information, identify and manage risk, and support mission critical decision making. Headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, BigBear.ai has additional locations in Virginia, Massachusetts, Michigan, and California. BigBear.ai will request COVID-19 vaccination status information as part of the onboarding process.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us. MITRE Labs, one of MITRE’s three business sectors, inspires breakthroughs in applied science and advanced technology to transform the future of U.S. scientific and economic leadership. Our goal is to deliver disruptive innovation to support our mission of solving problems for a safer world. In addition to executing on a rich set of programs sponsored through the six FFRDCs that MITRE operates on behalf of its sponsors, MITRE Labs works with broader federal, state, and local governments and has robust partnerships with industry and academia to drive impact in the public interest. MITRE Labs consists of approximately 4,000 technical staff organized into 15 innovation centers. The Artificial Intelligence (AI) Development Lead is responsible for driving program development outcomes across MITRE Labs that are consistent with MITRE Labs strategic directions for growth of impact in the field of AI. The position is responsible for supporting MITRE Labs principal investigators to drive business development efforts; lead the management of efficient proposal development and contract capture; and effectively partner both within MITRE and with external partners to expand MITRE’s work to new federal sponsors. Responsibilities: AI is a critical technology area for the United States and is a core priority for the White House and Congress. Over the past few years, MITRE has dramatically grown its talent base, capabilities, and differentiated expertise in AI to satisfy the needs of our federal sponsors, but sees even greater opportunity to combine our mission acumen with R&D depth to drive development and adoption of responsible AI. This position will support and manage effective business capture to enable the underlying mission of MITRE Labs: tackling national- and global-scale challenges in applied sciences and advanced technology, specifically in the domains of artificial intelligence including AI assurance, AI test & evaluation, and AI for strategic decision support. Reporting to the Director of Strategy and Growth, this position will collaborate closely with leadership from MITRE Labs’ AI and Autonomy Innovation Center and stakeholders from across the company. Specific responsibilities include: Organize and execute long-lead business development, including sponsor and partner engagement. Lead lateral coordination and capture of center-scale R&D proposal efforts, to include opportunity identification, maturation, and qualification, assembling a team of performers, and leading the proposal writing process. Submit high-quality and compliant proposals, and lead successful proposals through the contracting stage. Develop materials and opportunities to communicate internally and externally to advance MITRE Labs’ mission. Provide input into marketing efforts to advance MITRE Labs’ brand and reputation and capability awareness across government, industry, and academia. Develop and maintain strong relationships with partners aligned with MITRE’s AI strategy. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree with 10 years of related experience; or Master’s degree with 8 years or related experience; or a PhD with 5 years’ experience; or equivalent combination of related education and work experience. Applicants selected for this position will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or applicants who are eligible for security clearances. Required Qualifications: Master’s degree in a relevant scientific or engineering discipline; Deep understanding of federal S&T landscape, thorough knowledge of federal agencies who fund research and development; Demonstrated track record of success in shaping, pursuing, and winning national initiatives in science and technology, to include proposal writing, customer engagement, and coordinating proposal teams; An understanding of academic research landscape, active network of connections and potential partners in academia, government, and industry; Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Preferred Qualifications: Active security clearance; Demonstrated track record of significant program development and business capture in the artificial intelligence field; Experience in building and implementing new science and technology programs across federal, industry, and non-profit/academia stakeholders. This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s): None This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s): Secret MITRE requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. MITRE will provide reasonable accommodation to those with a medical condition, disability or a sincerely held religious belief that prevents them from receiving a vaccine so long as it does not create an undue hardship for MITRE and/or does not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of the employee or others in the workplace. MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. MITRE recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of age; ancestry; color; family medical or genetic information; gender identity and expression; marital, military, or veteran status; national and ethnic origin; physical or mental disability; political affiliation; pregnancy; race; religion; sex; sexual orientation; and any other protected characteristics. For further information please visit the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission website EEO is the Law Poster, EEO is the Law Poster-Supplement and Pay Transparency. job_title: Senior Data Scientist / Business Systems Analyst
job_Description: Senior Data Scientist / Business Systems Analyst Job Category: Information Technology Time Type: Full time Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret Employee Type: Regular Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10% Type of Travel: Local Come join our Ever Vigilant CACI team for a new and rewarding career to be part of an innovative cloud-based technical/IT focused team to apply cutting edge cloud technologies creating and evolving a highly visible data analytics platform solutions to support the Department of Defense (DoD), our nation, and allies. The CACI Team is seeking a highly motivated senior level Data Scientist with plenty of growth opportunities in the field and a desire to “harness the power of the cloud in an Agile world”. As a Data Scientist, you will hone your skills and contribute to the team collaborating with technical SMEs and other teams to innovate with exploratory data analysis from complex or high-dimensional datasets. What You'll Get To Do: o Coordinates the team efforts and mission supporting the processing of structured and unstructured data to derive patterns and trends, in order to draw scientifically credible analytical conclusions base on quantitative analysis. o Lead assessments, identify and evaluate novel algorithms, methodologies, tools and data sources with application of DoD/Government analytics. o Uses software languages (Python or similar) and tools such as R, Tableau or other related ones, to develop scripts and automate data gathering and analysis. o Lead and support the team and client with descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics. o Helps clients overcome their most difficult challenges and continuously broadening expertise in areas like agile development, cloud-based development, containerization and server less technologies and processes. o Provides data analytics, data visualization, and AI capabilities that will improve national security. o Assists in the identification of new opportunities to build state-of-the-art data analytics and immutable architectures. o Engage with customers onsite, from CACI offices, and remotely when necessary. You’ll Bring These Qualifications: o Hands on customer engagement skills, working directly with the customers in overcoming their data challenges. o Experienced with and using data science and statistical languages, such as R, PowerBI, Tableau, or Qlik, to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. o Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts and ability to learn new concepts to apply to trade. o Experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models for visual representation for reporting, both internally and externally. o Understanding of, or desire to learn, applications and technologies related to VM and Cloud environments. o Understanding of, or desire to learn, using serverless technologies, including services like Lambda, API Gateway, Step Functions, or SAM. o Familiarity with and growing knowledge with scripting in a variety of languages including Python and Ruby or similar o Ability to obtain a Secret (or higher) clearance. o BA or BS degree. Desired Qualifications: o Experience with data analytics, big data, and cloud-native technologies. o Experience with data operations pipeline, machine learning techniques, and working with or creating data architectures. o Knowledge or ability to learn programming languages (such as Python, SQL, C/C++, JAVA, and Perl). o Experience working in Agile and DevOps environments. o Experience with Hadoop, NoSQL and tools such as Storm, Kafka, NiFi, Spark. o MA or MS degree a big plus. o Any education or certification towards AWS Certification family and/or Security+. What We Can Offer You:   We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.  Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.  We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.  We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.  For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.  Company Overview: At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. As a federal contractor, CACI is subject to any federal vaccine mandates or other customer vaccination requirements. As such, any offers of employment may be contingent upon COVID-19 vaccination or an approved accommodation. All new hires are required to report their vaccination status.

Supporting the Most Exciting and Meaningful Missions in the World  Intelligence Data Scientist  Responsibilities: Conducts data analytics, data engineering, data mining, exploratory analysis, predictive analysis, and statistical analysis, and uses scientific techniques to correlate data into graphical, written, visual and verbal narrative products, enabling more informed analytic decisions. Proactively retrieves information from various sources, analyzes it for better understanding about the data set, and builds AI tools that automate certain processes. Duties typically include: creating various ML-based tools or processes, such as recommendation engines or automated lead scoring systems. Performs statistical analysis, applies data mining techniques, and builds high quality prediction systems. Should be skilled in data visualization and use of graphical applications, including Microsoft Office (Power BI) and Tableau; major data science languages, such as R and Python; managing and merging of disparate data sources, preferably through R, Python, or SQL; statistical analysis; and data mining algorithms. Should have prior experience with large data Multi-INT analytics, ML, and automated predictive analytics. Requirements: Clearance  : TS/SCI Demonstrates in-depth knowledge and understanding of the labor category activities required to meet mission requirements. Demonstrates mastery of qualitative and quantitative analytic methodologies and pursue developments in academia or other fields that affect tradecraft methodology. Demonstrates ability to define comprehensive, new, or unique research approaches that enable rigorous assessments to address and contribute to high-level tasks. Demonstrates in-depth analysis of analytic operations and knowledge management issues across organizational and intra-IC boundaries and clearly articulates key findings. Demonstrates ability to work independently and with minimal to no oversight. Demonstrated ability to review analytic products for cogent arguments, tradecraft standards, and adequate support for conclusions; routinely tests analytic rigor of analytic products. Preferred: Demonstrates ability to define problems, supervise studies and lead surveys to collect and analyze data to provide advice and recommended solutions. Demonstrates analytic leadership and expertise in identifying, planning, developing, and executing analytic production methodologies, tradecraft and techniques aligned with labor category mission. Demonstrates extensive ability to provide strategic advice, technical guidance and expertise to Military Commander, Senior Government Staff (GG-15 and above), Defense Planners and policymakers (e.g. Undersecretary Level or Higher). Desired Experience:  Minimum 20 years of experience conducting analysis relevant to the specific labor category with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 years. Desired Education:  Master’s Degree in an area related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education: or have a Bachelor’s degree related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and an additional 5 years of related Senior experience for a total of 17 years, as a substitute to the Master’s Degree. job_title: Sr. Technical Program Manager, Amazon Go and Dash Cart
job_Description: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline. 5+ years of experience in the software, firmware, or machine learning/research industry, taking a product through its complete lifecycle.  Track record of successfully delivering complete systems (hardware, firmware, software, algorithms) on time, to scope, with high quality.  Excellent analytical and interpersonal skills, with ability to work successfully across all engineering disciplines.  Maturity, judgment, and proven ability to lead and influence others.  Independently driven, resourceful, and able to deliver results with minimal direction.  Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.  High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.  Job summary   Note: This position is listed as virtual, with a preferred location of Arlington, VA  We are developing advanced technologies that enhance the experience of shoppers in physical stores. Designed and custom-built by Amazon, existing products such as the Amazon Dash Cart and Amazon Go integrate a variety of advanced technologies including computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. We are hiring a Sr. Technical Program Manager to lead our Computer Vision Applied Science programs. As a Senior Technical Program Manager, you will be primarily responsible delivering a proof-of-concept product and taking it all the way to production. You will manage the scope of work for a team of scientists and software engineers. You will interface with our hardware and product management teams to bring alignment. You will be making appropriate trade-offs to optimize for quality and time-to-market, clearly communicating goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal and external cross-functional and remote project teams. The right candidate will possess a strong program management background, will have demonstrated experience leading medium to large projects, and will have a well-rounded technical background in machine learning, signal processing, software and hardware. You will also have an innate curiosity, and strong intuition for physical processes. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in, and get the job done You must be fully competent in a variety of project management tools, methodologies and techniques for all phases of the project lifecycle and exhibit demonstrated proficiency in core project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, resources, quality and risk management, reporting and metric development/tracking.  Job Responsibilities:   Work with engineering and product management to translate business requirements into technical/functional specifications for our firmware & computer vision/algorithms teams.  Build project plans, balancing business needs with project risks and resource availability.  Drive engineering project execution, make technical tradeoffs, track and report on status, and resolve blocking issues.  Coordinate cross-team efforts spanning dozens of retail services and tools teams.  Assist with recruiting, hiring process, and growing the team.  Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related technical discipline  Strong project management fundamentals, and ability to align the team to scalable mechanisms  Experience with managing large data-driven machine learning projects  Experience communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple business units  Experience with agile or other program management methodologies  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Strong technical, analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive decisions  Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs, and evaluate opportunistic new ideas with internal and external partners  Experience in taking complex products global  High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

You will be working with many of our nation’s leading scientists and innovative companies. Join our Winning Team as a Senior Data Analyst  When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” is taken to new heights. Even today, while working remotely, temporarily due to COVID-19, our culture is strong and our team is connected!   New CARFAX employees must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based positions. On your first day of employment with CARFAX you will be required to upload your vaccination card into our HR system.   If hired, HR will consider requests for reasonable accommodation on an individualized basis. As a  Senior Data Analyst , you will be working with the Data Services and Data Technologies teams to provide key analytical support to a machine learning initiative. You will work collaboratively with a team of engineers and data scientists to help design, build and scale our ambitious machine learning and natural language processing solutions. As a Senior Data Analyst, your responsibilities  will include: Gathering training data for the existing deep learning, ML and NLP solutions Providing actionable ad hoc analytics insights for internal stakeholders Designing and building recurring reports for internal stakeholders to make data-driven decisions Identifying and implementing ways to supercharge data quality and data integrity Using advanced analytical methods to explore and extract additional data value for existing and emerging products Documenting analysis results and presenting value to stakeholders Creating reusable processes to assist data evaluation and analysis across teams within Data Center To be considered for this role, you will need: 3-5 years of direct experience performing advanced data analytics or a Master’s Degree in Statistics, Data Analytics or related field 3+ years’ experience in SQL/Spark, R, Python Strong grasp of statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, GLM, etc. Understand NLP concepts like: Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Data Tokenization, Lexical Semantics, Relationship Extraction, etc. Ability to effectively communicate analysis and insights to all levels of the organization A passion for continuous learning Confidence to challenge the status quo Automotive industry experience a plus

Summary:  Yorktown Systems Group is seeking a highly qualified Data Engineer to provide Data Science, Models and Simulations (DSMS) support to the Training and Doctrine Command (TRADOC) G-2. The TRADOC G-2 facilitates and acts as the principal enabler for continuous learning across all TRADOC lines of effort through acquiring, analyzing, creating, organizing, applying, and transferring data, information, and knowledge in the context of current and future operations. The G-2 is responsible for delivering the Operating Environment to facilitate the training of deploying units on joint, national, and interagency information, emerging asymmetric capabilities gleaned from world-wide operations; integrating processes, practices, concepts and materiel capabilities into Joint and Service DOTMLPF solutions; and coordinating with the training centers to provide realistic enemy and environmental signatures into models and simulations in support of realistic training.   The Cloud Engineer will provide the TRADOC G-2 with a deep understanding of operational data, analytical capabilities, and an innovative mindset to solve problems and a customer focused advocate that can work in an agile fast-paced team environment using cutting edge technologies. Data Engineers are responsible for the creation and maintenance of analytics infrastructure that enables almost every other function in the data world. They are responsible for the development, construction, maintenance and testing of architectures to include databases and large-scale processing systems.   Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:  Support, develop or contribute to data ingestion/workflows, data streaming, data processing, data catalogs, data analysis & exploration, data quality, data visualization, business process management/business rules processing, data exchange, or data modeling and ETL processes using open source and user- developed tools.  Collaborate with other Data Science, Operations and Intelligence Analysts on data science and big data problems to include utilizing the data science process for defining the question, identifying the needed data sources, developing data model & data capture strategy, developing technical design specifications, and implementation.  Design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable data management systems.  Design, develop, implement, and maintain code to support data processing, flows thru the Data Lake, and self-service analytics.  Provide support to Data Science Teams in order to conduct critical thinking, coding, math, machine learning, deep learning, Artificial Intelligence, communication, data architecture, and problem solving as an entry level Data Scientist  All other duties as assigned or directed.   Required Qualifications:  Bachelor?s degree in Information Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical area.  3-5 years of relevant consulting or industry experience.  Experience with SQL, unstructured storage, and graph databases.  Experience defining and optimizing data schemas and connections with the aforementioned technologies.  Hands-on experience with enterprise level data ingestion, data discovery & analysis, data cleansing, data transformation, data modelling, and data visualization.  Understanding of data architecture, governance, and management.  Understanding of and experience with analyzing structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.  Ability to plan, prioritize, and execute multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills; experience building scalable, distributed, high availability services; enjoy technical challenges and constantly striving to improve existing services, systems, and techniques.  Experience with Git or other version control tools.   Desired Qualifications:  Experience working with open source or COTS big data tools on Azure or AWS cloud environment.  Experience working with Geospatial data.  Experience working with Azure Data Factory, Hive, Pig, S3/Azure Storage Services, Zeppelin, Spark, Elasticsearch, NiFi, Talend etc.  Experience using APIs to include SharePoint, WordPress, and Gremlin.  Strong orientation to quantitative and qualitative, data-driven analysis using stats packages such as SAS; SPSS; R; Python and other open-source packages.  Familiar with the capabilities and value of Service intelligence systems.   Clearance:  Ability to obtain Secret clearance is required.   Location:  FT Eustis, VA   Travel:  Travel (5%) is required.

Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.  Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing. As a Data Scientist at Micron Technology Inc., you will employ techniques and theories drawn from many fields within the broad areas of mathematics, statistics, and information technology, including signal processing, probability models, machine learning, statistical learning, computer programming, data engineering, pattern recognition and learning, visualization, uncertainty modeling, Big Data, and high performance computing to uncover patterns in data from which predictive models, actionable insights, and solutions can be developed. You will interact with product, process, operations and/or service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. In this position, you will be expected to develop and code software programs, algorithms and/or automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. You will also interpret and communicate insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.  Responsibilities and Tasks  Align to, Understand, and Prioritize Analytic Goals to Address Business Opportunities and Value  Maintain an intimate understanding of company and department strategy  Understand the business objectives in order to develop or establish success criteria metrics  Translate business problems into one or more data science projects/solutions  Lead Efforts to Identify Signals in Data that Address Use Cases  Understand business processes (data sources and meaning)  Manage and optimize data discovery and cleansing  Understand and collect relevant data  Identify new data sources in the network that will create new insights to business needs  Explore relevant data through visualization and statistical methods  Collect, Organize, and Prepare Data for Analysis  Work with various volumes of data from multiple disparate sources and perform data analysis and mining to generate solutions to business problems  Ensure processes taken to maintain data integrity  Understand available data and what data is relevant  Collaborate with data architects (IS engineers, BI engineers, DBAs, etc.) to ensure that data needed is available  Develop and automate ETL jobs for various volumes of data  Uncover Patterns in Data, Develop Models, and Evaluate Validity of Solutions  Develop expertise in data mining and analytic methods  Determine statistical validity and significance (pick out signals from noise)  Identify and apply appropriate analytical models  Evaluate results using statistical methods and improve the model where appropriate  Develop predictive models  Deploy Data Science Models into Business Processes  Present findings and deliver recommendations using effective presentation and data visualization techniques  Collaborate with software engineers to deploy data science solutions into production applications  Ensure that the models are easy to support and maintain  Regularly review deployed models and monitor for continual improvement  Validate that the business value has been met Education Required  Masters Degree or equivalent experience Statistics Physics Computer Science Engineering Operations Research Applied Mathematics Related field of study Desired  Doctorate Degree or equivalent experience Statistics Physics Computer Science Engineering Operations Research Applied Mathematics Related field of study Experience Required  2+ years experience in any of the following: Related field Additional Information: Must have industry experience applying a variety of statistical methods (e.g., sampling methodology, ANOVA, multiple linear regression, design of experiments, predictive modeling, multivariate analyses, spatial statistics, statistical process control, time series, mixed models, variance components, reliability statistics, etc.). Experience applying statistics in the semiconductor industry is preferred. Qualifications  · Desire to identify and/or work on data analysis projects that will improve product (NAND, DRAM, etc.) yield and quality, reduce costs and cycle time, and optimize business practices.  · Experience with R, JMP, and/or other statistical software including scripting capability for automating analyses.  · Ability to extract data from different databases via SQL and other query languages and applying data cleansing, outlier identification, and missing data techniques.  · Ability to work with small, big, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.  · Project management skills that will be used to lead domestic and global teams, define project objectives, create and assign tasks, and track project completion and benefits.  · Capable of visually summarizing and presenting advanced analytical results and monetary benefits to middle and executive management.  · Flexible and accommodating but willing to voice opinions and make recommendations.  · Ability to influence decision makers by turning data into valuable information.  · Machine learning and other advanced analytical methods.  · Knowledge and/or experience working with Hadoop and/or Teradata.  · Programming experience in Python, HIVE, PIG, etc.  · Ability to deal with ambiguity Workplace Travel Required? · Yes Travel Details Both domestic and international travel are required. Overview: Will support PEO-Digital and Network Operations to provide technical direction for problem definition, analysis, requirements development, and implementation for systems in a Naval Network Operations Environment. The individual will provide recommendations and advise on system improvements, optimization, or maintenance efforts for the following areas: information systems architecture; networking; telecommunications; automation; communications protocols; risk management/electronic analysis; software lifecycle management; software development methodologies. Responsibilities: Extract data from multiple data sources used within network operations processes (service desk, incident, event, problem) to gather operational data into data models. Configure data modeling and operational tools to capture, analyze, visualize, and presenting data findings to stakeholders utilizing various visual formats; compiles and presents complex information for audiences at varying levels of technical understanding Processes, cleanses, and verifies the integrity and reliability of data used for analysis; uses iterative processes and validates findings Establishes and maintains appropriate data collection and storage systems, programs, and procedures for building analytic systems; ensures accurate and efficient data management. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand organizational needs; identifies relevant data sources for information. Provide recommendation or integration solutions for greater functionality within existing and future data systems Maintain current knowledge of relevant developments in area of expertise in the Network Operation Environment and Service Desk Functions, Event, Incident, Problem Management, or IT Service Continuity Support data modernization, network transformation initiatives, service delivery planning and analysis. Develop and deliver working level and senior leadership briefs Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. Qualifications: Secret Clearance Required, Active Top Secret Clearance Preferred The candidate must have a bachelor’s degree in a related field or 10 years of experience with a Navy acquisition program within a Department of Defense (DoD) agency, or experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models and is familiar with the following: Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java JavaScript, etc. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Strong technical background, proficient in the development of management systems and databases Experience with Network Monitoring, Network Performance, and ITSM Tools Experience in organizational Cloud environments Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. ITIL Foundations Must be proficient in Microsoft applications such as but not limited to Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook, and other M365 capabilities. Effective critical thinking and problem-solving skills Detailed-oriented, self-driven, able to work well within a team that supports a fluid, dynamic environment. Ability to plan, create, program, and manage complex statistical/predictive models. Familiarity with basic principles of distributed computing and/or distributed databases. Ability to apply statistical principles and processes to meet a range of information requirements. Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical personnel. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques and real-world advantages/drawbacks. Ability to think independently with minimal oversight, as well as demonstrate exceptional written and oral communications skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, across all organizational functions and levels. Additional Desired Skills/Experience : Experience with ServiceNow, BMC ITSM Tools, and Business Objects M365 and/or Azure Fundamentals Certifications ITIL Service Operations or Service Design Microsoft Project or Planner Experience with Agile methodology and development

Primary Purpose A key Scaled Agile team member who will collaborate with the development team to implement machine learning models in production. Drive efforts from requirements, design, training to implementation of Machine Learning (ML) models. Apply ML models, techniques, and algorithms on IT infrastructure monitoring use cases, working with time series data. Collaborate with other Machine learning engineers with direction from the lead data scientist in building, training, and implementing the ML models into production. Major Responsibilities Solve complex problems with datasets and optimize existing ML libraries and frameworks. Write code to evaluate and visualize model outputs. Package and deploy models to production environment. Perform hyperparameter and architecture search on existing models. Create novel models to synthesize product attributes. Troubleshoot existing models in production. Document Machine Learning processes and keep abreast of Developments in Machine Learning. Establish standards, guidance and best practices for ML Platform. Establish the appropriate monitoring and alerting of solution events related to performance, scalability, availability, and reliability. Advance existing ML model frameworks to implement algorithms and associated tools. Build prototypes for demonstration and illustration purposes for clients and senior leaders. Provides technical leadership, guidance and direction to other team members. Education / Experience / Expertise Master’s degree with a minimum of 5 years of experience. PhD preferred. Experience using machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch Solid foundation in machine learning - feature engineering, classification, clustering, supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning techniques Solid understanding of scripting languages (Python – 10/10 a must), with strong software engineering background Experience tuning Algorithms, Software Architecture, data structures Working experience with Scikit-learn, TensorFlow(2.x), Keras, Pandas, NumPy and other Python ML libraries Working experience with high dimensional space anomaly detection problems Have worked on classification, regression, or reinforcement learning models Understand model performance metrics, PCA, and data bias analysis Comprehensive understanding of the full AI/ML lifecycle Scope Individual Contributor - No supervisory responsibilities. Provides functional expertise through day-to-day work tasks. Works under the supervision of management. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time. Overview: In this role, you will use code and approved tools to import, synthesize, and analyze data to research and forecast issues and opportunities for our government clients to help them improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their processes and programs. Your contributions will make an impact on the critical missions of our government clients, solving challenges that aim to improve millions of lives across the globe. Responsibilities: As a Senior Data Analyst, you will: Prepare user centric visualizations and dashboards using Tableau and other BI tools (e.g., Power BI) Write complex SQL series to extract data and stream it from transaction system to DataMart and feed into Dashboards. Perform advanced analytics, data and model validation, and quality assurance while working as full-time on-site staff at the customer or employer facility. Research, assess, and report the analytic impact of the customers’ business processes, data dependencies, or standards implementation across various internal customer systems. Extract, synthesize, and analyze data from internal customer systems to provide data management design and development recommendations. Champion the use of, recommend, lead knowledge sharing sessions, or train in advanced analytics best practices and integration to improve customer data literacy. Create or revise metrics to assess program, project, data use, or data flow effectiveness. Research data to identify and provide root cause analysis reports of prioritized issues; provide data or business rules guidance to correct data quality issues; or make recommendations to improve performance or use of data. Develop procedures and automated workflows to import/export data and integrate analytics or related process improvements per oversight, technical, and business specifications. Work closely with stakeholders to clarify business requests, understand database relationships, extract data, conduct and validate analysis, obtain customer feedback, and present preliminary or final results appropriate for the intended audience. Assess the feasibility of and prioritize business requests, communicating status and risk with the project manager on a routine schedule. Analyze and translate functional specifications into technical specifications for each analytic workflow step, including an estimated level of effort, projecting hours to complete the request, designating milestones and due dates within project timeframes and meeting those as appropriate. Write and maintain clear and concise documentation within approved documentation repositories allowing stakeholders to understand goals, operational steps, data dictionaries and business glossaries, data flows, or preservation plans, as applicable. Perform quality assurance or peer review for junior team members or technical teams, as needed. Other similar professional duties may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: 5+ years of professional and proven experience in a related role. 5+ years of experience working with databases like SQL Server. 3+ years of experience building DataMarts using data streaming or ETL processes. Demonstrated customer focus, initiative, and problem-solving for each analytic workflow step. Expertise in conducting and driving adoption and integration of basic to advanced data analytics: descriptive, diagnostic, predictive (natural language processing, data and text mining, pattern matching, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.). Proficiency in MS SharePoint (data import/export, integration) and Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, other advanced functions). Expertise using R or Python AND SQL to query, synthesize, and analyze data with integration and data use adoption in other tools or applications (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, SharePoint). Proficiency with facilitating or presenting, to include knowledge sharing sessions. Practical experience using advanced analytics to optimize one or more of the following areas is strongly preferred: data domains; data ownership or stewardship; metadata management; master data management; business processes; data quality; data architecture, data access. Knowledge of how best to visually display advanced analytics (data and text mining, pattern matching, natural language processing, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.) is strongly preferred. Knowledge in data science (i.e., exploratory process to discover unknown patterns and correlations or identify questions/scope) is preferred Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, and Statistics, Healthcare Analytics or related field is required.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us. MITRE's Enterprise Design, Discovery & AI Department is seeking a team member who is passionate about search and interested in growing his/her knowledge in artificial intelligence (AI) to help us revolutionize knowledge reuse within MITRE. This person will work closely with the business to understand search/information needs. They will also work closely with the internal teams (IT, security, accounts administration, etc.) to ensure that all efforts are fully integrated. The position requires strong organizational and time management skills as individuals work in a fast-paced environment with multiple projects. Successful candidates must be strategic but also hands-on, with excellent communication skills. If hired, you will support MITRE's artificial intelligence and machine learning work as part of our Intelligent Enterprise strategy. You will interact closely with a host of technical developers and operational support staff. Strong interpersonal skills and a commitment to customer service are both required. Responsibilities include: Understand MITRE’s business needs Serve as a thought leader on search and AI including strategy, technologies, and optimization techniques Design, plan, and implement performant and optimized search and AI systems based on open source and commercial solutions Problem solve and troubleshoot technical issues related to search including challenges with content, access, security/permissions Analyze performance data, formulate insights, and translate them to actionable next steps Manage daily relationships with vendors and technology platforms Lead functional testing of search and AI solutions Communicate to senior leadership to influence change, and end users to ensure adoption of enterprise search and AI solutions. Required Qualifications: 5+ years of experience and a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, including specialization in an Al-related field of study, or related job experience 2+ years of experience with search, analytics, machine learning, deep learning, data engineering, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning (ML) Preferred Qualifications: Desire to learn and grow in the areas of analytics, machine learning, deep learning, data engineering, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning (ML) Project management experience Hands-on experience using tools such as: Python, TensorFlow, AWS, or IBM Watson Proven knowledge of search engines, SEO, API options, and third-party tools Experience with search architecture, federated search architecture, connectors, crawling conventions, indexing details, etc. Hands-on experience with search applications such as Microsoft Search, Elastic, SOLR, Elastic Cloud, and the Watson Suite Experience with content platforms (i.e., Drupal, WordPress, SharePoint, OneDrive, M365, etc.) Strong analytical capabilities and experience with query logs analysis Excellent communication skills - able to explain difficult concepts using simple language and graphics Strong fundamentals in software engineering, object-oriented programming, web application development, and software architecture Proven ability to work independently to learn new technologies, techniques, processes, languages, platforms, systems Experience with enterprise search Propensity for accuracy and attention to detail This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s): None This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s): Secret MITRE requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
